hemoglobin.description: Protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout your body

hematocrit.description: Percentage of blood volume made up of red blood cells

white blood cell.description: Cells that fight infection and are part of your immune system

neutrophils.description: Most common type of white blood cell; primary defenders against bacterial infections

lymphocytes.description: White blood cells that produce antibodies and fight viral infections

monocytes.description: White blood cells that help remove dead or damaged tissues and fight chronic infections

eosinophils.description: White blood cells active during allergic reactions and parasitic infections

basophils.description: Least common white blood cell; involved in inflammatory and allergic responses

red blood cell.description: Cells that carry oxygen from your lungs to the rest of your body

mean corpuscular volume.description: Average size of your red blood cells

mean corpuscular hemoglobin.description: Average amount of hemoglobin in a red blood cell

mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentratio.description: Average concentration of hemoglobin in a given volume of red blood cells

red cell distribution width.description: Variation in size of red blood cells

platelet.description: Cell fragments that help your blood clot and stop bleeding

glucose.description: Main sugar in your blood and primary energy source for your cells

cholesterol.description: Waxy substance used to build cells; high levels can increase heart disease risk

ldl cholesterol.description: Low-density lipoprotein; carries cholesterol to arteries where it can build up

hdl cholesterol.description: High-density lipoprotein; carries cholesterol away from arteries to the liver

triglycerides.description: Type of fat in blood; high levels can increase heart disease risk

creatinine.description: Waste product from muscle metabolism; indicates kidney function

blood urea nitrogen.description: Waste product from protein breakdown; indicates kidney function

glomerular filtration rate.description: Calculated value that indicates how well your kidneys are filtering waste

sodium.description: Electrolyte that regulates water balance and nerve/muscle function

potassium.description: Electrolyte essential for heart, muscle, and nerve function

chloride.description: Electrolyte that helps maintain fluid balance and blood pressure

carbon dioxide.description: Measures the amount of carbon dioxide in the blood; indicates acid-base balance

calcium.description: Mineral essential for bones, teeth, heart, muscles, and nerves

iron.description: Mineral needed to make hemoglobin and transport oxygen in blood

ferritin.description: Protein that stores iron; indicates your body's iron reserves

vitamin d.description: Vitamin essential for bone health, immune function, and calcium absorption

vitamin b12.description: Vitamin needed for nerve function, DNA synthesis, and red blood cell formation

folate.description: B vitamin needed for cell division and DNA synthesis

thyroid stimulating hormone.description: Hormone that controls thyroid gland activity and metabolism

free t4.description: Active form of the primary thyroid hormone

free t3.description: Active form of the thyroid hormone that affects many physiological processes

alanine aminotransferase.description: Liver enzyme; elevated levels may indicate liver damage

aspartate aminotransferase.description: Enzyme found in liver and heart; elevated levels may indicate organ damage

alkaline phosphatase.description: Enzyme found in liver and bone; elevated levels may indicate liver or bone issues

gamma-glutamyl transferase.description: Enzyme found in the liver and bile ducts; sensitive indicator of liver or bile duct injury

bilirubin.description: Yellow compound from red blood cell breakdown; high levels cause jaundice

lactate dehydrogenase.description: Enzyme involved in energy production; elevated levels can indicate tissue damage

amylase.description: Enzyme produced by the pancreas and salivary glands to digest carbohydrates

lipase.description: Enzyme produced by the pancreas to help digest fats

albumin.description: Protein made by liver; indicates liver function and nutritional status

total protein.description: Sum of albumin and globulin proteins in blood

globulin.description: Group of proteins in blood; important for liver function, blood clotting, and fighting infection

erythrocyte sedimentation rate.description: Rate at which red blood cells sink; indicates non-specific inflammation

hemoglobin a1c.description: Average blood sugar over past 2-3 months; used to diagnose and monitor diabetes

c-reactive protein.description: Marker of inflammation in the body; elevated in infections and chronic conditions

uric acid.description: Waste product found in blood; high levels can cause gout or kidney stones

magnesium.description: Mineral important for many systems in the body, especially muscles and nerves

phosphorus.description: Mineral that works with calcium to build bones and teeth

prostate specific antigen.description: Protein produced by the prostate gland; elevated levels can indicate prostate issues

testosterone.description: Primary male sex hormone; plays key roles in muscle mass, bone density, and sex drive

estradiol.description: Primary form of estrogen; important for reproductive and bone health

follicle stimulating hormone.description: Hormone that helps control the menstrual cycle and the production of eggs/sperm

luteinizing hormone.description: Hormone that triggers ovulation in women and testosterone production in men

cortisol.description: The body's main stress hormone; affects metabolism and immune response

insulin.description: Hormone that allows your body to use sugar (glucose) for energy

homocysteine.description: Amino acid in the blood; high levels can be a risk factor for cardiovascular disease

creatine kinase.description: Enzyme found in the heart, brain, and skeletal muscle; indicates muscle damage

nt-probnp.description: Marker for heart strain or heart failure

copper.description: Essential trace mineral for energy production and iron metabolism

zinc.description: Essential mineral for immune function, protein synthesis, and wound healing
